alert.note: Alert for Clay; Early; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 12:34PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dale, Henry, north central Houston, Clay, southwestern Randolph and northwestern Early Counties through 130 PM EDT/1230 PM CDT/... At 1234 PM EDT/1134 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Texasville to 9 miles northwest of Headland to near Newton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Headland, Fort Rucker, Ozark, Enterprise, Midland City, Kinsey, Level Plains, Newton, Webb, Columbia, Pinckard, Grimes, Newville, Napier Field, Bellville, Haleburg and Bluffton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT/500 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
